title: Last Digits of ID Numbers
question_text:
The histogram below displays the last digit of the ID numbers for fifty students. This distribution is best described as
This distribution is best described as
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2017. All rights reserved.
solution:
All of the digits from 0 to 9 have almost the same number of observations (either 4, 5, or 6).

There are no peaks or clusters in the histogram, so this is best described as a uniform distribution.

The other answer choices would only be correct if we could see clusters of higher bars in one or more sections of the histogram. Higher clusters are not seen in this histogram.

Note: a uniform distribution is a type of symmetric distributions, which represent distributions that are symmetric across a line of symmetry. Another example of symmetric distributions includes normal distribution.

Explanation of Distractors

Choice 'A' is incorrect - in a skewed left shaped distribution, the data shows a tail on the left and a large cluster on the right. This description does not match the given distribution.

Choice 'B' is incorrect - in a skewed right shaped distribution, the data shows a tail on the right and a large cluster on the left. This description does not match the given distribution.

Choice 'C' is incorrect - in a nearly normal distribution, we would expect to see a majority of frequencies occurring near the median or mean with a symmetrical distribution leveling off from both directions of the median or mean.

Choice 'D' is incorrect - in a bimodal distribution, we would expect to see two distinct peaks. In this case, we do not see a strong clustering, let alone two.
